etymologies: 1930s: from German Chromatographie(see chromato-, -graphy), early separations being displayed as a number of colored bands or spots

definitions: the separation of a mixture by passing it in solution or suspension or as a vapor (as in gas chromatography) through a medium in which the components move at different rates.
shortDefinitions: technique for separation of mixture by passing it in solution or suspension through medium in which components move at different rates
